plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: A popular ornamental flower known for its bright and diverse colored blooms, chrysanthemums are widely cultivated and symbolic of autumn in many cultures.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, especially East Asia and Europe
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are the official flower of November in the United States, symbolizing optimism and joy.

plants.name: Dianella tasmanica
plants.description: A native Australian plant producing striking blue to violet flowers and unique blue berries, often found in understories and coastal regions.
plants.funFact: This plant's berries are an important food source for native birds, aiding in seed dispersal.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub famous for its glossy leaves and large, rose-like flowers appearing in late autumn through winter.
plants.location: East Asia, also cultivated globally in subtropical climates
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers were historically prized in Japan for tea ceremonies, and the plant gives its name to 'camellia tea'.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub tolerant of heat and poor soils, oleander blooms profusely through the warm months into late autumn in Mediterranean and subtropical zones.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, parts of Asia, North Africa
plants.funFact: Despite its beauty, oleander is highly toxic if ingested, containing cardiac glycosides.
